page.title: 15CLANNABOROUGH CHURCH
page.content: Clannaborough Church is dedicated to St Petrock; this, together with the circular churchyard on the line of a pre-Christian trackway, indicates that the church was a very early one built on a pagan site. The present church is partly Norman, with a simple nave and tower. The rectors date from 1272. In the last century it fell into poor repair, and was substantially refurbished by Mrs Wreford in 1858-9. In the 50 years up to 1936, when a carillon of 8 bells was installed, only 2 parishioners, a Rector and his wife, had been buried in the church- yard, and only 8 parishioners married, but many people from Copplestone have been married or buried there. The church is now incorporated into the North Creedy team ministry, and the vicar is the Rev. Shillingford.
